final_production_data.main_heading: New Model Developed to Study Sense of Smell
headlines: Three-dimensional model used to study regeneration of nerve tissue in the nose
One type of stem cell may play a more significant role than originally believed
Stay tuned for more information on the study's findings
final_production_data.tts_script: Using a newly devised, three-dimensional model to study the regeneration of nerve tissue in the nose, researchers have discovered that one type of stem cell thought to be dormant may play a more significant role in preserving the sense of smell than originally believed.

original_raw_news.original_title: Researchers develop innovative model to study sense of smell
original_raw_news.original_summary: Using a newly devised, three-dimensional model to study the regeneration of nerve tissue in the nose, researchers have discovered that one type of stem cell thought to be dormant may play a more significant role in preserving the sense of smell than originally believed.
